description: Retrospective Permission for Rear Garden Canopy erected over the raised decking area (to allow level access), constructed out of timber post and polycarbonate sheeting for the roof covering.
decision_conditions: The proposed development due to the excessive depth, awkward relationship of the roof profile and inappropriate use of materials would constitute an incongruous addition to the detriment of the character and appearance of the existing dwelling and harmful to the rear garden environment of the adjoining neighbours contrary to Policy DC61 of the LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies Development Plan Document, the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document and Policy 7.4 of the London Plan.

The proposed development would, by reason of its excessive depth, awkward roof relationship and position close to the boundaries of the site forms an unneighbourly feature which has a detrimental impact and overbearing effect resulting in an increased sense of enclosure and loss of outlook harmful to the amenity of the neighbouring properties and the visual amenity of the immediate locality, contrary to Policy DC61 of the London Borough of Havering LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD 2008, and the London Borough of Havering Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2011.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to Mr Malcolm Clarke, via email on 16th November 2020.
